meanings.definition: The action of reducing or restricting something.
meanings.sent1: The curtailments in spending helped us save money for our vacation.
meanings.sent2: The government announced curtailments in public services due to budget constraints.
meanings.sent3: The curtailments in dessert portions left everyone craving for more sweets.
meanings.sent4: Her strict curtailments on screen time turned her into the 'tech police' among her friends.
meanings.sent5: The curtailments in water supply during the drought made us appreciate every drop.

meanings.definition: The act of cutting short or reducing in duration.
meanings.sent1: The curtailments of the meeting allowed us to finish early and enjoy the rest of the day.
meanings.sent2: The curtailments in the play's running time made it more engaging for the audience.
meanings.sent3: The curtailments in class hours made the students cheer for unexpected early dismissals.
meanings.sent4: His abrupt curtailments of conversations often left others wondering what he really meant.
meanings.sent5: The curtailments in the movie's length made it a quick but satisfying watch.
